questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is a key requirement of embedded systems?
question_texts: Which of the following is a key requirement of embedded systems?

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary purpose of a real-time operating system (RTOS) in an embedded system?
question_texts: What is the primary purpose of a real-time operating system (RTOS) in an embedded system?

options.option_text: To ensure timely and deterministic task execution

questions.question_text_1: You need to store the number of milliseconds elapsed in a microcontroller program. The value can go up to 100,000 ms. Which of the following data types is most appropriate?
question_texts: You need to store the number of milliseconds elapsed in a microcontroller program. The value can go up to 100,000 ms. Which of the following data types is most appropriate?

options.option_text: It clears the bits specified in mask in x
It sets the bits specified in mask in x
It toggles the bits specified in mask in x
It reads the digital value from pin 13
It sets pin 13 to HIGH, turning on the LED
It sets pin 13 as an input
It writes an analog value to pin 13

questions.question_text_1: Which communication protocol is commonly used for asynchronous serial communication between a microcontroller and a computer, using separate lines for transmitting (TX) and receiving (RX) data?
question_texts: Which communication protocol is commonly used for asynchronous serial communication between a microcontroller and a computer, using separate lines for transmitting (TX) and receiving (RX) data?

questions.question_text_1: In a microcontroller, if you want a timer to trigger an interrupt every 0.5 seconds but the timer’s maximum count is limited, which technique can you use?
question_texts: In a microcontroller, if you want a timer to trigger an interrupt every 0.5 seconds but the timer’s maximum count is limited, which technique can you use?

options.option_text: Use a prescaler to divide the timer clock

questions.question_text_1: Which component of a microcontroller is responsible for decoding instructions and controlling the operation of other units?
question_texts: Which component of a microcontroller is responsible for decoding instructions and controlling the operation of other units?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following features makes a microcontroller suitable for low-power embedded applications?
question_texts: Which of the following features makes a microcontroller suitable for low-power embedded applications?

options.option_text: Ability to run multiple desktop applications

questions.question_text_1: In which of the following scenarios would a microprocessor (MPU) be more appropriate than a microcontroller (MCU)?
question_texts: In which of the following scenarios would a microprocessor (MPU) be more appropriate than a microcontroller (MCU)?

options.option_text: Designing a temperature sensor for an oven
Running a desktop operating system for a personal computer
Managing a simple LED display panel

questions.question_text_1: If you use a 10-bit ADC to digitize a signal in the range of 0 to 5V, what is the minimum difference (approx) between two voltages that you can measure?
